Accommodation and Food Services_entry_ra.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Accommodation and Food Services. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.

Administrative and Support and Waste Man.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.

The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.

Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_entr.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.

Construction_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Construction. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.
Construction_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

Educational Services_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.

Finance and Insurance_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Finance and Insurance. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.

The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.

Information_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.
Information_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.

Manufacturing_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.
Manufacturing_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.

Retail Trade_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.
Retail Trade_entry_rate.short_description: Businesses entry rate in Retail Trade

Transportation and Warehousing_entry_rat.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.

Utilities_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.
Utilities_entry_rate.statement: {value} percent of businesses are new in {region_name}.

Wholesale Trade_entry_rate.long_description: Percent of new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region): \[entry\_rate=\frac{new\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.

Retail Trade_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.
Retail Trade_exit_rate.short_description: Businesses exit rate in Retail Trade

Transportation and Warehousing_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.
Transportation and Warehousing_exit_rate.long_name: Exit Rate in Transportation and Warehousing
Transportation and Warehousing_exit_rate.short_description: Businesses exit rate in Transportation and Warehousing
Transportation and Warehousing_exit_rate.short_name: Exit Rate in Transportation and Warehousing

Utilities_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.

Wholesale Trade_exit_rate.long_description: Percent of closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region): \[exit\_rate=\frac{closed\_businesses}{all\_businesses}\] in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.
Wholesale Trade_exit_rate.short_description: Businesses exit rate in Wholesale Trade

Accommodation and Food Services_new_busi.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Accommodation and Food Services. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.

Administrative and Support and Waste Man.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.
Administrative and Support and Waste Man.long_name: New Businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services

Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunti.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.
Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunti.long_name: New Businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting

Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_new_.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.
Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_new_.long_name: New Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation

Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_new_.short_name: New Businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation

Construction_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Construction. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.

Educational Services_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.

Finance and Insurance_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Finance and Insurance. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.
Finance and Insurance_new_business.long_name: New Businesses in Finance and Insurance
Finance and Insurance_new_business.short_description: New businesses in Finance and Insurance
Finance and Insurance_new_business.short_name: New Businesses in Finance and Insurance

Health Care and Social Assistance_new_bu.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.
Health Care and Social Assistance_new_bu.long_name: New Businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
Health Care and Social Assistance_new_bu.short_description: New businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
Health Care and Social Assistance_new_bu.short_name: New Businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance

Information_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.
Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_name: New Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
Management of Companies and Enterprises_.short_description: New businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
Management of Companies and Enterprises_.short_name: New Businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises

Manufacturing_new_business.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.

Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

Other Services (except Public Administra.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Other Services (except Public Administration). Real Estate and Rental and Leasing_new_b.long_description: Count of all new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.

Construction_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Construction. Educational Services_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. Information_number_business.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Information. Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.

Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Count of all businesses. in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.

Health Care and Social Assistance_solopr.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.

Information_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.

Manufacturing_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.

Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

Real Estate and Rental and Leasing_solop.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.

Transportation and Warehousing_solopropr.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.

Utilities_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.

Wholesale Trade_soloproprio_business.long_description: Count of sole proprietor businesses. in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.

Construction_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Construction. Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.

Educational Services_perc_small.long_description: percent of small businesses. in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.

Educational Services_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Educational Services. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.

Finance and Insurance_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Finance and Insurance. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.

Health Care and Social Assistance_perc_s.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Health Care and Social Assistance. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.

Information_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Information. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Management of Companies and Enterprises. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.

Manufacturing_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Manufacturing. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.

Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.

Other Services (except Public Administra.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Other Services (except Public Administration). The Other Services (except Public Administration) sector comprises establishments engaged in providing services not specifically provided for elsewhere in the classification system.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=81&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 81}.

Professional, Scientific, and Technical.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.

Public Administration_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Public Administration. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.

Real Estate and Rental and Leasing_perc_.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.

Retail Trade_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Retail Trade. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.

Transportation and Warehousing_perc_solo.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Transportation and Warehousing. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.

Utilities_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Utilities. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.

Wholesale Trade_perc_soloproprio.long_description: percent of sole proprietor businesses. in Wholesale Trade. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.
